result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drekail D Moore

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Drekail D Moore in Court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in Court for Drekail D Moore.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Defendant requested to appear via Zoom Video Conference. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 


FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions, and PreTrial Incarceration Sheet
PRETRIAL INCARCERATION CREDIT; received and filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum; received and filed.
-received and filed.

Defendant Drekail D Moore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in Court for Drekail D Moore.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State did not provide an offer to Defense. placed offer on the record. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant Drekail D Moore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Drekail D Moore.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Arraignment and Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. State previously filed INFORMATION. Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. Final PreTrial documents were not filed. Defense has not received an offer form the State. Parties requested a new Final PreTrial date. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
OTP already signed and filed for Jury Trial date.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding Defendant's request to appear via Zoom for Arraignment/Final PreTrial. 
Clerk made arrangements with DCI. 
State cancelled Order to Produce.
Arraignment/Final PreTrial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Drekail D Moore not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Drekail D Moore.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Arraignment. Defendant was not produced, order to produce was not filed. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court advised Defense, if Defendant wants to appear in person for next hearing Attorney Hall must notify the District Attorney, but Defendant is allowed to Waive right to appear.  Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment/Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

 Arraignment/Final PreTrial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:45 am. Defendant may appear via Zoom Video Conference. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial.  (Drekail D. Moore - #2022006660, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
EXPIRES November 14, 2022.

Defendant Drekail D Moore in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Drekail D Moore in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective T. Pileggi. Court took judicial notice of 19CF3270. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant's Motion to Dismiss; received and filed.

Defendant Drekail D Moore not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Drekail D Moore not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant Drekail D Moore in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Drekail D Moore in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Drekail D Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.

Court ordered no contact with M.M.B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Drekail D Moore in court with attorney .  Defendant Drekail D Moore in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Drekail D Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
